Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Identify and explore digital systems including hardware and software components for a purpose
Elaboration: Taking photos using a tablet device, with permission, to share with other students, for example close-up photos of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ cultural artefacts, such as woven mats or baskets, that reveal intricate detail

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Identify and explore digital systems including hardware and software components for a purpose
Elaboration: Recognising digital systems that they interact with at home and school, for example a smartphone, laptop or programmable toy

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Identify and explore digital systems including hardware and software components for a purpose
Elaboration: Making a model of a digital system, using it in a role-play scenario and describing its features, for example a cardboard box with a keyboard and screen with app icons

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Identify and explore digital systems including hardware and software components for a purpose
Elaboration: Naming and using digital systems that they interact with at home and school, for example using a touchpad to move the cursor on a laptop, or a keyboard to type a simple message on a tablet

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Identify and explore digital systems including hardware and software components for a purpose
Elaboration: Using different digital systems to explore what these do and how to use them; for example, selecting the camera icon allows students to take photos of different types of objects in a classroom

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Identify some data that is personal and access their school account with a recorded username and password
Elaboration: Listing things that contain personal and public data, for example photos of themselves with their family (private) and photos of local community areas (public)

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Identify some data that is personal and access their school account with a recorded username and password
Elaboration: Identifying apps and websites they use where their personal data could be made visible, for example photos of themselves on parents’ or carers’ social media, or their username being shown to others in online games

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Identify some data that is personal and access their school account with a recorded username and password
Elaboration: Using a username and password recorded in a private place to access a digital system, for example logging into a school computer using details given on a card by a teacher

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore patterns in data and represent data as objects, pictures, symbols, numbers and words
Elaboration: Using a symbol to represent an idea, but knowing that the symbol is not the data itself, for example the symbols and colours on both the Australian Aboriginal flag and the Torres Strait Islander flag

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore patterns in data and represent data as objects, pictures, symbols, numbers and words
Elaboration: Drawing a picture representing each of their family members and their interests, for example drawing one family member with a surfboard and another reading a book

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore patterns in data and represent data as objects, pictures, symbols, numbers and words
Elaboration: Using coloured blocks to represent an attribute of people, for example representing students and their sports houses, birthdays, pets or favourite ice-cream flavours

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore patterns in data and represent data as objects, pictures, symbols, numbers and words
Elaboration: Recognising the equivalence of different representations of numbers, including words, digits and tally marks

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore and use the basic features of common digital tools to create, locate and communicate content for a diverse audience
Elaboration: Finding digital images of (local) Australian flora and fauna or places for use in a story and including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ language names for the items

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore and use the basic features of common digital tools to create, locate and communicate content for a diverse audience
Elaboration: Using familiar digital systems to create content to present to the class, for example using presentation software to retell a story

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore and use the basic features of common digital tools to create, locate and communicate content for a diverse audience
Elaboration: Taking, storing safely and presenting photos of class work, for example locating photos they took of their work to show to parents or carers or for a teacher to upload to the class shared folder

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore and use the basic features of common digital tools to create, locate and communicate content for a diverse audience
Elaboration: Using a digital camera or drawing app to create a picture, for example making a card for a family member that includes a photo and short message

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore and use the basic features of common digital tools to create, locate and communicate content for a diverse audience
Elaboration: Creating individual pieces of work that contribute to a group task; for example, each student contributes a recipe and photo of their favourite food to create a digital class recipe book

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore and use the basic features of common digital tools to share content and collaborate, demonstrating agreed behaviours and supported by trusted adults
Elaboration: Taking photos of class work and sharing with other students in the class using classroom messaging software with teacher guidance

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore and use the basic features of common digital tools to share content and collaborate, demonstrating agreed behaviours and supported by trusted adults
Elaboration: Applying agreed standards of behaviour when sharing content with other class members, for example using language that is considered by all students and the teacher to be appropriate when they are writing messages to each other

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explore and use the basic features of common digital tools to share content and collaborate, demonstrating agreed behaviours and supported by trusted adults
Elaboration: Considering the need for online safety when sharing information, for example recognising that personal information such as a photo could be used inappropriately

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Recognise and discuss that some websites and apps store their personal data online
Elaboration: Identifying apps and websites they use where their personal data could be made visible, for example photos of themselves on parents’ or carers’ social media, or their username being shown to others in online games

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Recognise and discuss that some websites and apps store their personal data online
Elaboration: Sharing examples of the data collected by apps and websites they commonly use, for example usernames and email addresses used by school websites and games to log in

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Recognise and discuss that some websites and apps store their personal data online
Elaboration: Discussing the importance of asking permission from a parent or carer before entering personal details online such as address, phone number and date of birth

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Investigate simple problems for known users that can be solved with digital systems
Elaboration: Investigating internet-based translation tools and how similar digital tools could promote the use of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ languages or assist communications, for example responding to cultural stories of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Peoples

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Investigate simple problems for known users that can be solved with digital systems
Elaboration: Investigating familiar and easily understood problems with a few steps needed to solve them, for example deciding what to wear to school by checking the forecast on a weather app

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Investigate simple problems for known users that can be solved with digital systems
Elaboration: Identifying how digital systems are used to solve problems at school, for example taking class attendance or borrowing a library book

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Investigate simple problems for known users that can be solved with digital systems
Elaboration: Exploring how a familiar problem could be solved using a digital solution, for example creating a model robot using cardboard boxes and explaining how it could be used to move around tables on the classroom floor

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Follow, describe and represent algorithms involving a sequence of steps, branching (decisions) and iteration (repetition) needed to solve simple problems
Elaboration: Rearranging into the correct order a series of mixed-up pictures that describe a story, for example stories authored and published by Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Follow, describe and represent algorithms involving a sequence of steps, branching (decisions) and iteration (repetition) needed to solve simple problems
Elaboration: Following a short, ordered sequence of steps and making decisions to solve a simple problem, for example following a recipe or directions to reach a location

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Follow, describe and represent algorithms involving a sequence of steps, branching (decisions) and iteration (repetition) needed to solve simple problems
Elaboration: Describing the steps and decisions (in the correct order) needed to solve a simple problem, for example writing, saying, drawing or photographing the steps needed to make a sandwich

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Follow, describe and represent algorithms involving a sequence of steps, branching (decisions) and iteration (repetition) needed to solve simple problems
Elaboration: Identifying and representing the decisions needed to solve a problem and the next steps to follow in each case, for example ‘If it is raining, take a raincoat, otherwise take a hat’

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Follow, describe and represent algorithms involving a sequence of steps, branching (decisions) and iteration (repetition) needed to solve simple problems
Elaboration: Following algorithms that repeat a single step a fixed number of times (iteration), for example ‘Practise spelling a word 5 times’ or ‘Throw and catch a ball with a partner 10 times’

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Discuss how existing digital systems satisfy identified needs for known users
Elaboration: Discussing how digital systems are used to store and access information, and how that information helps us learn about our environments, interactions and leisure activities, for example how interactive versions of stories authored and published by Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people preserve important cultural expressions

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Discuss how existing digital systems satisfy identified needs for known users
Elaboration: Describing how familiar digital systems meet the needs of individuals, for example how different family members use a tablet for different needs – to play videos, read the news or follow a recipe

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Discuss how existing digital systems satisfy identified needs for known users
Elaboration: Sharing ideas about how digital systems are used at school for learning, for example sharing a student’s work with the class on an interactive display screen to provide class feedback on their writing

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Discuss how existing digital systems satisfy identified needs for known users
Elaboration: Discussing how a range of digital systems support personal needs and impact on others, for example text-to-speech software, which can be used to meet the communications needs of people with impaired or no vision
